artworkTitle: Prehistoric Art depicted in Rococo Art Style

keySubjects: Cave walls or rocky landscape elements (as subject matter)
conceptDefinition.narrativeFocus: Depict a group of simplified, active human figures engaged in hunting a large bison or similar prehistoric animal. Focus on the action and relationship between hunters and prey.
conceptDefinition.desiredEmotion: A mix of ritualistic reverence, primal tension, and the importance of the hunt for survival.
symbolismHints: Emphasize the size and power of the animal
Use repetitive patterns if suggesting ritual
references: Altamira cave art depictions of bison

styleDefinition.origin: Rococo Art (Europe, primarily France, c. 1715 - late 18th Century AD)
visualCharacteristics: Emphasis on lightness, elegance, grace, and intimacy
Intricate and ornate decoration featuring asymmetrical curves (S-curves, C-curves), scrolls, shell motifs ('rocaille'), and foliage
Playful, witty, often sentimental or frivolous themes (love, leisure, mythology, pastoral scenes, 'fêtes galantes')
Soft, sensual depiction of figures, often with porcelain-like skin
Asymmetry is a key element in decoration and composition
A reaction against the formality and grandeur of the preceding Baroque style
techniques: Oil painting simulation with light, feathery, or delicate brushwork
Pastel simulation (capturing soft textures and colors)
Emphasis on smooth finishes and subtle modeling
styleDefinition.mediumSimulation: Oil painting on canvas (or Pastel drawing, decorative stucco/giltwood)

colorPalette.description: Predominantly light, airy, and pastel color palette. Soft pinks, light blues, mint greens, creamy yellows, ivory, white, and accents of gold or silver. Colors are often pearlescent or shimmering, avoiding strong contrasts and deep shadows.

styleDefinition.textureEmphasis: Smooth, refined surfaces. Emphasis on simulating soft, luxurious textures like silk, satin, porcelain skin, and delicate foliage. Brushwork is often light, feathery, and blended.
styleDefinition.compositionStyle: Often asymmetrical, using fluid S-curves and C-curves. Light, graceful, and dynamic arrangements without Baroque heaviness. Can be highly decorative and intricate but maintains an overall sense of lightness and airiness. Often suited for intimate settings.
references: François Boucher (Portraits of Madame de Pompadour, mythological scenes)
Jean-Honoré Fragonard ('The Swing', 'The Progress of Love' series)
Interior decorations of the Hôtel de Soubise, Paris
Amalienburg hunting lodge, Nymphenburg Palace, Munich

sceneContext.lightingStyle: Soft, diffused, and luminous lighting, avoiding the dramatic shadows and harsh contrasts of the Baroque. Creates a light, airy, cheerful, or intimate atmosphere that enhances the pastel palette and delicate forms.
sceneContext.cameraView: Intimate viewpoints, often medium shots or compositions designed as part of a decorative scheme. Angles tend to emphasize graceful curves, asymmetry, and playful interactions rather than grandeur or stark drama.
sceneContext.settingSuggestion: Elegant and intimate settings are typical: ornately decorated domestic interiors (salons, boudoirs with mirrors, giltwood, boiserie, painted panels), idealized parklands or gardens for 'fêtes galantes', scenes of leisure, or settings for lighthearted mythological or amorous themes.

emphasize: Light, airy pastel color palette (pinks, light blues, creams, greens, yellows)
Delicate, feathery, or blended brushwork (oil or pastel simulation)
Asymmetrical compositions featuring S-curves, C-curves, scrolls ('rocaille')
Elegant, graceful, often slender figures with soft features
Playful, sentimental, amorous, or leisurely themes ('fêtes galantes')
Intricate, ornate, and delicate decoration and details
Soft, diffused, luminous lighting (avoiding strong shadows)
Smooth, refined textures (silk, satin, porcelain skin)
Overall feeling of lightness, grace, charm, and intimacy
avoid: Strong chiaroscuro, tenebrism, or dramatic dark shadows (Baroque)
Deep, intense, highly saturated, or dark color palettes (Baroque)
Intense drama, suffering, violence, or strong negative emotions
Heavy, monumental, solid, or overly muscular forms
Rigid symmetry, straight lines, severe formality
Gritty realism or depiction of poverty/hardship
Simple, austere, undecorated, or rustic settings
Visible heavy impasto or rough brushwork
